metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4813 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the Oracle VM VirtualBox component in OracleVirtualization VirtualBox prior to 4.0.34, 4.1.42, 4.2.34, 4.3.32, and5.0.8, when using a Windows guest, allows local users to affectavailability via unknown vectors related to Core.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4813` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

virtualbox - 4.3.34-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1
virtualbox-dkms - 4.3.34-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1
virtualbox-guest-dkms - 4.3.34-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1
virtualbox-guest-source - 4.3.34-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1
virtualbox-guest-utils - 4.3.34-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 4.3.34-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1
virtualbox-qt - 4.3.34-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1
virtualbox-source - 4.3.34-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: virtualbox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3.34-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1').
